content: are knit wise when you work the all-knit round following the slip stitch round you will experience a bit of resistance when knitting into the slipped stitches from the prior round no worries … that s because those stitches are twisted and that s what creates the texture repeat rnds 2 thru 5 until the hat measures 7 from the bottom edge end with round 5 the decrease section as written will add 2 to the hat for a slouchier fit knit additional repeats of rnds 2 thru 5 crown of hat decreases in this section you will be reducing the number of stitches on the needles to form the crown of hat change to double pointed needles when there aren t enough stitches to knit comfortably using the circular needle if you choose to use the optional stitch markers place on the needle after the k2tog as you work the first round of the decrease section slip these markers in subsequent rounds remove them when you re comfortable 1 k1 sl1 kw x5 k2tog around 8 sts decreased 88 sts remain 2 knit around 3 sl1 kw k1 x4 sl1 kw k2tog around 80 sts remain 4 knit around 5 k1 sl1 kw x4 k2tog around 72 sts remain 6 knit around 7 sl1 kw k1 x3 sl1 kw k2tog around 64 sts remain 8 knit around 9 k1 sl1 kw x3 k2tog around 56 sts remain 10 knit around 11 sl1 kw k1 x2 sl1 kw k2tog around 48 sts remain 12 knit around 13 k1 sl1 kw x2 k2tog around 40 sts remain 14 knit around 15 sl1 kw k1 sl1 kw k2tog around 32 sts remain 3 | pa ge 16 knit around 17 k1 sl1 kw k2tog around 24 sts remain 18 k2tog around 12 sts remain finishing cut the yarn leaving at least a 12 yarn end using the darning needle thread the yarn through the remaining 12 stitches at least twice cinch snugly and anchor the yarn weave in the yarn ends steam or block the hat if desired 4 | pa ge
